Tags.description: Select id (the default) to select a tag set by providing tag IDs. Select name to select a tag set by providing tag names. This is valid only when the Use Tags parameter is set to True.

Tags.title: Tag include Selector
Tags.name: tag_include_selector
Tags.description: Select Any (the default) to include hosts that match at least one of the selected tags. Select all to include hosts that match All of the selected tags.

Tags.title: Include Host with Tags Below
Tags.name: tag_set_include
Tags.description: Specify a tag set that you want to include in the scan. Hosts that match these tags will be included. You identify the tag set by providing tag name or IDs. You can enter multiple tag sets using a comma separator.

Tags.title: Tag Exclude Selector
Tags.name: tag_exclude_selector
Tags.description: Select Any (the default) to exclude hosts that match at least one of the selected tags. Select All to exclude hosts that match all of the selected tags.

Tags.title: Exclude Host with Tags Below
Tags.name: tag_set_exclude
Tags.description: Specify a tag set that you want to exclude from the scan. Hosts that match these tags will be included. You identify the tag set by providing tag name or IDs. You can enter multiple tag sets using a comma separator.

Tags.title: Use IP Not Range Tags
Tags.name: use_ip_nt_range_tags
Tags.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to scan all IP addresses defined in tags. Clear this option, i.e, set to False (the default) to select from all tags (tags with any tag rule).

Tags.title: Scanners In Tagset
Tags.name: scanners_in_tagset
Tags.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to distribute the scan to scanner appliances that match the asset tags specified for the scan target. By default, this is set to False.

parameters.title: Runtime HTTP Header
parameters.name: runtime_http_header
parameters.value: (Optional) Sets a custom value in order to drop defenses (such as logging, IPs, etc.) when an authorized scan is being run. The value you enter will be used in the “Qualys-Scan:” header that will be set for many CGI and web application fingerprinting checks. Some discovery and web server fingerprinting checks will not use this header.

parameters.title: IP Network ID
parameters.name: ip_network_id
parameters.description: (Optional) ID of a network used to filter the IP addresses or IP ranges specified in the IPs/Ranges parameter. Specify a custom network ID, or specify 0, which is the default for the Global Default Network - this is used to scan hosts outside of your custom networks. Note: This parameter is valid only when the Network Support feature is enabled for the user’s account

operations.title: PC - Get Scan List
operations.description: Retrieves the list and details of all policy compliance scans that are present in the user's account on the Qualys cloud, or specific policy compliance scans based on the input parameters you have specified.

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: scan_id
parameters.description: ID of the scan for which you want to retrieve compliance scan details from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Scan Reference
parameters.name: scan_ref
parameters.description: Scan Reference for which you want to retrieve compliance scan details from the Qualys cloud. For a compliance scan, the format is: compliance/98765456.12345

parameters.title: Scan State
parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Scan state(s) for which you want to retrieve compliance scan details from the Qualys cloud. Select one or more scan states from the available options: Running, Paused, Canceled, Finished, Error, Queued (scan job is waiting to be distributed to scanner(s), or Loading (scanner(s) are finished, and scan results are being loaded onto the platform).

parameters.title: Scan Type
parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type of scan or which you want to retrieve compliance scan details from the Qualys cloud. You can select one of the following options: On Demand, Scheduled, or API.

parameters.title: Target IPs
parameters.name: target
parameters.tooltip: Multiple entries or ranges are supported
parameters.description: IP addresses whose compliance scan details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud. You can enter multiple IP addresses using a comma separator, or you can add a range of IP addresses using a hyphen (-).

parameters.title: User Who Launched Scan
parameters.name: user_login
parameters.tooltip: Enter the login name for a valid Qualys user account.
parameters.description: Compliance scan details will be retrieved from the Qualys cloud based on the user login that you specify in this field.

parameters.title: Show Scan Launched After Datetime
parameters.name: launched_after_datetime
parameters.tooltip: Show only scans launched after a certain date and time
parameters.description: Retrieve compliance scan details for all vulnerability scans that were launched after the datetime you have specified in this field from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Show Scan Launched Before Datetime
parameters.name: launched_before_datetime
parameters.tooltip: Show only scans launched after a certain date and time
parameters.description: Retrieve compliance scan details for all vulnerability scans that were launched after the datetime you have specified in this field from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Processed Scans
options: Show scans that are Not Processed
parameters.name: processed
parameters.description: Process state(s) of the compliance scans whose details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud. You can select Show only Processed scans or Show scans that are not Processed scans. If you do not specify any option, then the scan list output is not filtered based on the processed state.

parameters.title: Show Asset Group Information
parameters.name: show_ags
parameters.tooltip: True: Shows Asset Group Information in Output
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include asset group information for each compliance scan in the output. By default, this is set to False, and the asset group information is not included in the output.

parameters.title: Show Option Profile Information
parameters.name: show_op
parameters.tooltip: True: Shows option profile information in output
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include option profile information for each compliance scan in the output. By default, this is set to False, and the option profile information is not included in the output.

parameters.title: Show Scan Status
parameters.name: show_status
parameters.tooltip: False: Not to Show scan status for each scan
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include the status information for each compliance scan in the output. By default, this is set to True.

parameters.title: Show Most Recent Scan
parameters.name: show_last
parameters.tooltip: True: Shows only the most recent scan
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include only the most recent compliance scan (which meets all other search filters in the request) information in the output. By default, this is set to False, and all vulnerability scans are included in the output.

operations.title: PC - Fetch Scan
operations.description: Downloads all the compliance management scan results from the Qualys cloud, or specific compliance management scan results based on the input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Scan Reference
parameters.name: scan_ref
parameters.description: Reference of the scan for which you want to download compliance management scan results from the Qualys cloud. Format for this field is: scan/987659876.19876

parameters.title: Download Result As an Attachment
parameters.name: add_vuln_as_attachment
parameters.tooltip: True: To add PC Scan results in a file and add it as an attachment in CyOPs™
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to download PC scan results in a file and add it as an attachment in CyOPs™.  The PC scan must have the status Finished in order to download the scan results.Clear this option, i.e., set it to False (default) to include PC scan results  in the connector output.

operations.title: PC - Manage Scan
operations.description: Manages a vulnerability management scan on the Qualys cloud, based on the scan reference and actions you have specified

parameters.title: Action
parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action that you want to perform on the compliance scan that you want to manage on the  Qualys cloud. You must choose one of the following actions: Cancel: Stops a compliance scan that is in progress on the Qualys cloud. Pause: Stops a compliance scan that is in progress on the Qualys cloud and changes its status to Paused. Resume: Restarts a compliance scan that has been paused on the Qualys cloud. Delete: Deletes a compliance scan from your user account on the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Scan Reference
parameters.name: scan_ref
parameters.description: Reference of the compliance scan that you want to manage, i.e., on which you want to perform the specified action on the Qualys cloud. Format for this field is: compliance/98765456.12345

operations.title: Get Schedule Scan List
operations.description: Retrieves the list and details of all scheduled scans present in the user's account on the Qualys cloud, or specific scheduled scans based on the input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Scan ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the scan whose scan schedule you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Show Active/Deactive Schedule Scans
parameters.name: active
parameters.description: You can select Show Deactivated Schedules or Show Active Schedules whose details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud.

operations.title: Get Vulnerability List
operations.description: Retrieves the list and details of vulnerabilities from KnowledgeBase on the Qualys cloud, based on the input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Details
parameters.name: details
parameters.tooltip: Amount of vulnerability information that you want to retrieve
parameters.description: Amount of vulnerability information that you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud. You can choose from the following values:  Basic (Default): Retrieves basic vulnerability information that includes basic elements plus CVSS Base and Temporal scores All: Retrieves all vulnerability information that includes all vulnerability details, including the Basic details  from the Qualys cloud. None: Retrieves only the vulnerability IDs from the Qualys cloud

parameters.title: QIDs
parameters.name: ids
parameters.tooltip: Multiple entries or ranges are supported
parameters.description: QIDs whose vulnerability information you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud. In this case, vulnerability information of only those QIDs that have specified will be retrieved from the Qualys cloud. You can enter multiple hosts using a comma separator, or you can add a range of hosts using a hyphen (-).

parameters.title: Minimum QID
parameters.name: id_min
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities that have a QID number greater than or equal to a specified QID
parameters.description: Minimum QID value based on which you want to retrieve vulnerability information from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Maximum QID
parameters.name: id_max
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities that have a QID number less than or equal to a specified QID
parameters.description: Maximum QID value based on which you want to retrieve vulnerability information from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Is Patchable
options: Show Vulnerabilities that are Not Patchable
parameters.name: is_patchable
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only vulnerabilities that are patchable or not patchable. You can choose from the following options: Show Vulnerabilities that are Patchable Show Vulnerabilities that are Not Patchable

parameters.title: Last Modified After
parameters.name: last_modified_after
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities last modified after a certain date and time.
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been last modified after the datetime you have specified. The list of vulnerabilities will include vulnerabilities last modified by a user or by the service.

parameters.title: Last Modified Before
parameters.name: last_modified_before
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities last modified before a certain date and time.
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been last modified before the datetime you have specified. The list of vulnerabilities will include vulnerabilities last modified by a user or by the service.

parameters.title: Last Modified By User After
parameters.name: last_modified_by_user_after
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities last modified by a user after a certain date and time
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been last modified by the user after the datetime you have specified.

parameters.title: Last Modified By User Before
parameters.name: last_modified_by_user_before
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities last modified by a user before a certain date and time
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been last modified by the user before the datetime you have specified.

parameters.title: Last Modified By Service After
parameters.name: last_modified_by_service_after
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities last modified by the service after a certain date and time
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been last modified by the service after the datetime you have specified.

parameters.title: Last Modified By Service Before
parameters.name: last_modified_by_service_before
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities last modified by the service before a certain date and time
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been last modified by the service before the datetime you have specified.

parameters.title: Published After
parameters.name: published_after
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities published after a certain date and time
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been published after the datetime you have specified.

parameters.title: Published Before
parameters.name: published_before
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities published before a certain date and time
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that have been published before the datetime you have specified.

parameters.title: Discovery Method
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only those vulnerabilities that are assigned the specified discovery method. You can choose from the following options: Remote Authenticated Remote Only Authenticated Only
parameters.name: discovery_method
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities assigned a certain discovery method

parameters.title: Discovery Authentication Types
parameters.description: Filter the XML output to include only those vulnerabilities that have one or more specified authentication types. You can choose multiple values from the following options: Windows Oracle Unix SNMP DB2 HTTP MySQL VMware
parameters.name: discovery_auth_types
parameters.tooltip: Show only vulnerabilities having one or more authentication types.

parameters.title: Show PCI Reasons
parameters.name: show_pci_reasons
parameters.tooltip: True:To view the reasons in output
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True,to include the reasons for passing or failing PCI compliance (when the CVSS Scoring feature is turned on in the user’s subscription) in the output. Clear this option, i.e., set to False (default) to exclude the reasons the reasons for passing or failing PCI compliance from the output.

parameters.title: Show Supported Modules Information
parameters.name: show_supported_modules_info
parameters.tooltip: True:To view supported modules in output
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include the supported Qualys modules that can be used to detect each vulnerability in the output. Clear this option, i.e., set to False (default) to exclude the supported modules from the output.

parameters.title: Show Disabled Flag
parameters.name: show_disabled_flag
parameters.tooltip: True:To include the disabled flag for each vulnerability in output
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include the disabled flag for each vulnerability in the output. Clear this option, i.e., set to False (default) to exclude the disabled flag for each vulnerability from the output.

parameters.title: Show QID Change Log
parameters.name: show_qid_change_log
parameters.tooltip: True:To include QID changes for each vulnerability in output
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include QID changes for each vulnerability in output. Clear this option, i.e., set to False (default) to exclude QID changes for each vulnerability from the output

parameters.title: Download Result As an Attachment
parameters.name: add_vuln_as_attachment
parameters.tooltip: True: To add vulnerability results in a file and add it as an attachment in CyOPs™
parameters.description: Select this option, i.e., set it to True to add vulnerability results in a file and add it as an attachment in CyOPs™. Clear this option, i.e., set it to False (default) to include vulnerability results in the connector output.

operations.title: Get Report Template List

parameters.title: Scheduled Report ID

operations.title: Launch Scan Based Findings Report
operations.description: Launches a scan-based findings report in the user's account on the Qualys cloud, based on the scan references and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Template ID
parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of the template of the scan-based findings report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Report Title
parameters.name: report_title
parameters.description: (Optional) Title of the scan-based findings report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. A title can have a maximum of 128 characters.

parameters.title: Scan References
parameters.name: report_refs
parameters.description: Scan Reference based on which you want to launch the scan-based findings report on the Qualys cloud. Format for this field is: scan/1532543415.81997 You can enter multiple scan references using a comma separator.

parameters.title: Output Format
parameters.description: Format of the scan-based findings report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. You can choose from the following options:  PDF HTML MHT XMLbCSV Docx Note: Based on the output format that you choose, you might require to specify other parameters. For the PDF output, enter the following parameters:  In the PDF Password field, enter the password to be used for encryption. This information is valid and required when secure PDF distribution is enabled for the user's account. In the Recipient Group ID field, enter the IDs of the one or more distribution groups to whom this report should be distributed. You can enter multiple distribution group IDs using a comma separator. You can specify either the Recipient Group IDs or the Recipient Groups but not both. In the Recipient Group field, enter the names of the one or more distribution groups to whom this report should be distributed. You can enter multiple distribution group names using a comma separator. You can specify either the Recipient Group IDs or the Recipient Groups but not both. For the CSV output, you can select the Hide Header checkbox, i.e., set it to True, to omit the header information from the report. By default, this is set to False, i.e., Header information is included in the report
parameters.name: output_format

CSV.title: Hide Header
CSV.name: hide_header
CSV.tooltip: Valid for CSV format report only

parameters.title: IP Restriction
parameters.name: ip_restriction
parameters.tooltip: Multiple IPs and/or ranges are comma separated
parameters.description: (Optional) Important: Currently, this functionality is not available for this report type. Qualys might provide this functionality in the future. This field is used to restrict the scan report content to only the IP addresses you have specified. You can enter multiple IP addresses using a comma separator, or you can add a range of IP addresses using a hyphen (-).

parameters.title: Use Tags
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include assets tags in the scan-based findings report. parameters.name: use_tags
parameters.description: (Optional) Select this option, i.e., set it to True, to include assets tags in the report. By default, this is set to False, i.e., to include IP addresses/ranges and/or asset groups in the remediation report. If you set the Use Tags parameter as True, then you can optionally specify the following parameters:

False.title: IPs/Ranges
False.name: ips
False.tooltip: Multiple IPs and/or ranges are comma separated
False.description: (Optional) IP addresses or a range of IP addresses based on which you want to launch the remediation report on the Qualys cloud. You can enter multiple IP addresses using a comma separator, or you can add a range of IP addresses using a hyphen (-).

False.title: Asset Group IDS
False.name: asset_group_ids
False.tooltip: Multiple asset group IDs are comma separated
False.description: (Optional) Asset Group IDs based on which you want to launch the remediation report on the Qualys cloud. You can enter multiple IDs using a comma separator, or you can add a range of IDs using a hyphen (-).

True.title: Provide Tag Set By
True.name: tag_set_by
True.description: Select id (the default) to select a tag set by providing tag IDs. Select name to select a tag set by providing tag names. This is valid only when the Use Tags parameter is set to True.

True.title: Tag include Selector
True.name: tag_include_selector
True.description: Select Any (the default) to include hosts that match at least one of the selected tags. Select all to include hosts that match All of the selected tags.

True.title: Include Host with Tags Below
True.name: tag_set_include
True.description: Specify a tag set that you want to include in the scan. Hosts that match these tags will be included. You identify the tag set by providing tag name or IDs. You can enter multiple tag sets using a comma separator.

True.title: Tag Exclude Selector
True.name: tag_exclude_selector
True.description: Select Any (the default) to exclude hosts that match at least one of the selected tags. Select All to exclude hosts that match all of the selected tags.

True.title: Exclude Host with Tags Below
True.name: tag_set_exclude
True.description: Specify a tag set that you want to exclude from the scan. Hosts that match these tags will be included. You identify the tag set by providing tag name or IDs. You can enter multiple tag sets using a comma separator.

operations.title: Launch Compliance Report
operations.description: Launches a compliance report in the user's account on the Qualys cloud, based on the input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Template ID
parameters.name: template_id
parameters.description: ID of the template of the compliance report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Report Title
parameters.name: report_title
parameters.description: (Optional) Title of the compliance report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. A title can have a maximum of 128 characters.

parameters.title: Output Format
parameters.description: Format of the compliance report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. You can choose from the following options:  PDF HTML MHT CSV Note: Based on the output format that you choose, you might require to specify other parameters. For the PDF output, enter the following parameters:  In the PDF Password field, enter the password to be used for encryption. This information is valid and required when secure PDF distribution is enabled for the user's account. In the Recipient Group ID field, enter the IDs of the one or more distribution groups to whom this report should be distributed. You can enter multiple distribution group IDs using a comma separator. You can specify either the Recipient Group IDs or the Recipient Groups but not both. In the Recipient Group field, enter the names of the one or more distribution groups to whom this report should be distributed. You can enter multiple distribution group names using a comma separator. You can specify either the Recipient Group IDs or the Recipient Groups but not both. For the CSV output, you can select the Hide Header checkbox, i.e., set it to True, to omit the header information from the report. By default, this is set to False, i.e., Header information is included in the report
parameters.name: output_format

CSV.title: Hide Header
CSV.name: hide_header
CSV.tooltip: Valid for CSV format report only

parameters.title: Scan References
parameters.name: report_refs
parameters.description: (Required for PCI compliance report) For a PCI compliance report, either the technical or executive report, this parameter specifies the scan reference to include. The scan reference must be for a scan that was run using the PCI Options profile. Only one scan reference may be specified. Format for this field is: scan/1532543415.81997

parameters.title: IPs/Ranges
parameters.name: ips
parameters.tooltip: Multiple IPs and/or ranges are comma separated
parameters.description: (Optional) IP addresses or a range of IP addresses based on which you want to launch the compliance report on the Qualys cloud. You can enter multiple IP addresses using a comma separator, or you can add a range of IP addresses using a hyphen (-).

parameters.title: Asset Group IDS
parameters.name: asset_group_ids
parameters.tooltip: Multiple asset group IDs are comma separated
parameters.description: (Optional) Asset Group IDs based on which you want to launch the compliance report on the Qualys cloud. You can enter multiple IDs using a comma separator, or you can add a range of IDs using a hyphen (-).

operations.title: Launch Scorecard Report
operations.description: Launches a vulnerability scorecard report in the user's report share on the Qualys cloud, based on the scorecard type and other input parameters you have specified

parameters.title: Scorecard Type
parameters.description: Type of the vulnerability scorecard report you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. You can choose from the following options: Service Provided Scorecard or User Created Scorecard.
parameters.name: sc_type

Service Provided Scorecard.title: Scorecard Name
Service Provided Scorecard.description: If you specify the scorecard type as Service Provided Scorecard, then you can choose any of the following options as the scorecard name: Asset Group Vulnerability Report, Ignored Vulnerabilities Report, Most Prevalent Vulnerabilities Report, Most Vulnerable Hosts Report, or Patch Report. If you specify the scorecard type as User Created Scorecard, then you can specify the name of your choice for the report.
Service Provided Scorecard.name: name

parameters.title: Report Title
parameters.name: report_title
parameters.tooltip: If unspecified, the report title will be the score card name
parameters.description: (Optional) Title of the scorecard report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. A title can have a maximum of 128 characters. Note: If you do not specify a report title, then the scorecard name will become the report title also.

parameters.title: Output Format
parameters.description: Format of the scorecard policy report that you want to launch on the Qualys cloud. You can choose from the following options: You can choose from the following options:  PDF HTML MHT XML CSV Note: Based on the output format that you choose, you might require to specify other parameters. For the PDF output, enter the following parameters:  In the PDF Password field, enter the password to be used for encryption. This information is valid and required when secure PDF distribution is enabled for the user's account. In the Recipient Group ID field, enter the IDs of the one or more distribution groups to whom this report should be distributed. You can enter multiple distribution group IDs using a comma separator. You can specify either the Recipient Group IDs or the Recipient Groups but not both. In the Recipient Group field, enter the names of the one or more distribution groups to whom this report should be distributed. You can enter multiple distribution group names using a comma separator. You can specify either the Recipient Group IDs or the Recipient Groups but not both. For the CSV output, you can select the Hide Header checkbox, i.e., set it to True, to omit the header information from the report. By default, this is set to False, i.e., Header information is included in the report
parameters.name: output_format

CSV.title: Hide Header
CSV.name: hide_header
CSV.tooltip: Valid for CSV format report only

parameters.title: Source
parameters.tooltip: Required for 'Service Provided Scorecard'
parameters.description: Source asset groups based on which you want to launch the scorecard report on the Qualys cloud. You can choose from the following options: Asset Groups: This is the default option and select this option launch a scorecard report with all assets groups. Business Unit: Select this option to launch a scorecard report with all assets groups in a particular business unit. Note: Based on the source that you choose, you might require to specify other parameters.
parameters.name: source

Asset Groups.title: Asset Groups Titles
Asset Groups.name: asset_groups
Asset Groups.tooltip: Multiple asset group titles are comma separated
Asset Groups.description: Titles of asset groups, which are to be used as source asset groups for the scorecard report.

Asset Groups.title: All Asset Groups
Asset Groups.name: all_asset_groups
Asset Groups.description: If you can select the All Asset Groups checkbox, i.e., set it to True, to set all asset groups available in your account as the source asset groups for the scorecard report. You cannot use the Asset Groups and All Asset Groups parameters at the same time.

Business Unit.title: Business Unit
Business Unit.name: business_unit
Business Unit.description: Title of a business unit containing the source asset groups for the scorecard report. All asset groups in the business unit will be included in the report source.

Business Unit.title: Division
Business Unit.name: division
Business Unit.description: A business info tag identifying a division to which the asset group(s) belong. When specified, only asset groups with this tag are included in the scorecard report source.

Business Unit.title: Function
Business Unit.name: function
Business Unit.description: A business info tag identifying a business function to which that asset group(s) belong. When specified, only asset groups with this tag are included in the scorecard report source.

Business Unit.title: Location
Business Unit.name: location
Business Unit.description: A business info tag identifying a location where that asset group(s) are located. When specified, only asset groups with this tag are included in the scorecard report source.

parameters.title: Patch QIDs
parameters.name: patch_qids
parameters.tooltip: Required for Patch Report scorecard
parameters.description: (Optional) Patch QIDs for vulnerabilities or potential vulnerabilities with available patches, when these detected on the host, this means the host does not have the patches installed, and it will be reported in the scorecard output. You can enter multiple patch QIDs, up to a maximum of 10, using a comma separator. Note: Valid and required in case of a Patch Scorecard Report.

parameters.title: Missing QIDs
parameters.name: missing_qids
parameters.tooltip: Required for Patch Report scorecard
parameters.description: (Optional) Missing software QIDs when not detected on host means the host is missing software and it will be reported in the scorecard output. You can enter multiple patch QIDs, up to a maximum of 2, using a comma separator. Note: Valid and required in case of a Patch Scorecard Report.

operations.title: Download Saved Report
operations.description: Downloads a saved report in the user's account on the Qualys cloud, based on the report ID you have specified

parameters.title: Report ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.tooltip: The status of the report must be “finished”
parameters.description: ID of a saved report that you want to download in the user's account on the Qualys cloud. Note: To download a saved report, the status of the report must be Finished.

operations.title: Get Report List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of reports from the user's report share on the Qualys cloud

parameters.title: Report ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the report that is saved in the user's Report Share storage space, whose details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Report State
parameters.name: state
parameters.description: State of the report that is saved in the user's Report Share storage space, whose details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud. You can select from the available options: Running (reports are in progress), Finished, Submitted, Canceled or Errors.

parameters.title: User User Who Launched Report
parameters.name: user_login
parameters.tooltip: Enter the login name for a valid Qualys user account.
parameters.description: Login of the user who has launched the report in the user's Report Share, whose details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Show Reports Expires Before Datetime
parameters.name: expires_before_datetime
parameters.tooltip: Show reports that expire before specified date/time
parameters.description: Retrieve those reports from the Qualys cloud that expire before the datetime that you specify in this field.

operations.title: Get Scheduled Report List
operations.description: Retrieves a list of scheduled reports from the user's report share on the Qualys cloud

parameters.title: Report ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the scheduled report that is saved in the user's Report Share storage space, whose details you want to retrieve from the Qualys cloud.

parameters.title: Is Active
parameters.name: is_active
parameters.description: Filter the output to include only reports that are Active or Inactive. You can choose from the following options: List Active Scheduled Reports only List Inactive Scheduled Reports only

operations.title: Delete Report
operations.description: Deletes a saved report from the user's account on the Qualys cloud, based on the report ID you have specified

parameters.title: Report ID
parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of a saved report that you want to delete from the user's account on the Qualys cloud.
parameters.tooltip: The status of the report must be “finished”
